items.sentence: Tom has a souvenir magnet of Boston on his fridge.

I wonder why people always want to know the truth.
Instead of going to Boston, I\'m going to Chicago.
I am supposed to meet her at three this afternoon.
Let\'s just forget that this whole thing happened.
Let\'s make sure everything is where it should be.
Let\'s stay calm and think this through carefully.
I\'m not as busy now as I was this time last year.
I\'m not going to take you back to Boston with me.
I get the feeling you don\'t really want me to go.

I\'m tired of listening to all of Tom\'s bragging.
It will cost me a lot to furnish my new apartment.
Do you actually think I\'d do something like that?

I\'d like to know why Tom isn\'t going to do that.

Tom has been sitting there for a really long time.
I don\'t think I need to tell Tom about our plans.
This is one of the most dangerous places on earth.

This kind of weather makes me want to stay inside.

I think you know that Tom isn\'t going to do that.
None of you have any idea what I\'ve been through.

Would you like me to order the same thing for you?
